snippet: The Manhattan borough president, Scott M. Stringer, wants to restore New York City’s commuter tax to help stabilize the region’s mass transit network.
abstract: Manhattan borough president Scott M Stringer wants to restore New York City’s commuter tax to help stabilize the region’s mass transit network; he plans to describe plan to restore tax, eliminated in 1999, in speech at a meeting of the Association for a Better New York, a regular stop for city's presumptive mayoral candidates.
lead_paragraph: The Manhattan borough president, Scott M. Stringer, wants to restore New York City’s commuter tax to help stabilize the region’s mass transit network.

headline.seo: Stringer Seeks to Restore New York City Commuter Tax
headline.main: Call to Restore Income Tax on Suburbanites
headline.print_headline: Call to Restore Income Tax on Suburbanites
